# Summary

Part 1 of this dissertation provides basic research to provide core understanding of the issues relating to epistemological unease in science.
Chapter one reviewed some  overview of good, questionable, and ugly practices, but at the same time showed how publication practices are deeply problematic.
Chapter two provided how reproducibility can aid the understanding of results, but also the difficulty of communicating dissenting opinions. 
Chapter three indicated that questionable behaviors are present, but difficult to detect, hence, better to prevent than
